22/* Caveat emptor: this file deviates from the libuv convention of returning
23 * negated errno codes. Most uv_fs_*() functions map directly to the system
24 * call of the same name. For more complex wrappers, it's easier to just
25 * return -1 with errno set. The dispatcher in uv__fs_work() takes care of
26 * getting the errno to the right place (req->result or as the return value.)
27 */
28

91
92#define INIT(subtype) \
93 do { \
94 if (req == NULL) \
95 return UV_EINVAL; \
96 UV_REQ_INIT(req, UV_FS); \
97 req->fs_type = UV_FS_ ## subtype; \
98 req->result = 0; \
99 req->ptr = NULL; \
100 req->loop = loop; \
101 req->path = NULL; \
102 req->new_path = NULL; \
103 req->bufs = NULL; \
104 req->cb = cb; \
105 } \
106 while (0)
107
108#define PATH \
109 do { \
110 assert(path != NULL); \
111 if (cb == NULL) { \
112 req->path = path; \
113 } else { \
114 req->path = uv__strdup(path); \
115 if (req->path == NULL) \
116 return UV_ENOMEM; \
117 } \
118 } \
119 while (0)
120
121#define PATH2 \
122 do { \
123 if (cb == NULL) { \
124 req->path = path; \
125 req->new_path = new_path; \
126 } else { \
127 size_t path_len; \
128 size_t new_path_len; \
129 path_len = strlen(path) + 1; \
130 new_path_len = strlen(new_path) + 1; \
131 req->path = uv__malloc(path_len + new_path_len); \
132 if (req->path == NULL) \
133 return UV_ENOMEM; \
134 req->new_path = req->path + path_len; \
135 memcpy((void*) req->path, path, path_len); \
136 memcpy((void*) req->new_path, new_path, new_path_len); \
137 } \
138 } \
139 while (0)
140
141#define POST \
142 do { \
143 if (cb != NULL) { \
144 uv__req_register(loop, req); \
145 uv__work_submit(loop, \
146 &req->work_req, \
147 UV__WORK_FAST_IO, \
148 uv__fs_work, \
149 uv__fs_done); \
150 return 0; \
151 } \
152 else { \
153 uv__fs_work(&req->work_req); \
154 return req->result; \
155 } \
156 } \
157 while (0)
158
159
160static int uv__fs_close(int fd) {
161 int rc;
162
163 rc = uv__close_nocancel(fd);
164 if (rc == -1)
165 if (errno == EINTR || errno == EINPROGRESS)
166 rc = 0; /* The close is in progress, not an error. */
167
168 return rc;
169}
170
171
172static ssize_t uv__fs_fsync(uv_fs_t* req) {
173#if defined(__APPLE__)
174 /* Apple's fdatasync and fsync explicitly do NOT flush the drive write cache
175 * to the drive platters. This is in contrast to Linux's fdatasync and fsync
176 * which do, according to recent man pages. F_FULLFSYNC is Apple's equivalent
177 * for flushing buffered data to permanent storage. If F_FULLFSYNC is not
178 * supported by the file system we fall back to F_BARRIERFSYNC or fsync().
179 * This is the same approach taken by sqlite, except sqlite does not issue
180 * an F_BARRIERFSYNC call.
181 */
182 int r;
183
184 r = fcntl(req->file, F_FULLFSYNC);
185 if (r != 0)
186 r = fcntl(req->file, 85 /* F_BARRIERFSYNC */); /* fsync + barrier */
187 if (r != 0)
188 r = fsync(req->file);
189 return r;
190#else
191 return fsync(req->file);
192#endif
193}
194
195
196static ssize_t uv__fs_fdatasync(uv_fs_t* req) {
197#if defined(__linux__) || defined(__sun) || defined(__NetBSD__)
198 return fdatasync(req->file);
199#elif defined(__APPLE__)
200 /* See the comment in uv__fs_fsync. */
201 return uv__fs_fsync(req);
202#else
203 return fsync(req->file);
204#endif
205}
206
207
208UV_UNUSED(static struct timespec uv__fs_to_timespec(double time)) {
209 struct timespec ts;
210 ts.tv_sec = time;
211 ts.tv_nsec = (uint64_t)(time * 1000000) % 1000000 * 1000;
212 return ts;
213}
214
215UV_UNUSED(static struct timeval uv__fs_to_timeval(double time)) {
216 struct timeval tv;
217 tv.tv_sec = time;
218 tv.tv_usec = (uint64_t)(time * 1000000) % 1000000;
219 return tv;
220}
221
222static ssize_t uv__fs_futime(uv_fs_t* req) {
223#if defined(__linux__) \
224 || defined(_AIX71) \
225 || defined(__HAIKU__)
226 /* utimesat() has nanosecond resolution but we stick to microseconds
227 * for the sake of consistency with other platforms.
228 */
229 struct timespec ts[2];
230 ts[0] = uv__fs_to_timespec(req->atime);
231 ts[1] = uv__fs_to_timespec(req->mtime);
232 return futimens(req->file, ts);
233#elif defined(__APPLE__) \
234 || defined(__DragonFly__) \
235 || defined(__FreeBSD__) \
236 || defined(__FreeBSD_kernel__) \
237 || defined(__NetBSD__) \
238 || defined(__OpenBSD__) \
239 || defined(__sun)
240 struct timeval tv[2];
241 tv[0] = uv__fs_to_timeval(req->atime);
242 tv[1] = uv__fs_to_timeval(req->mtime);
243# if defined(__sun)
244 return futimesat(req->file, NULL, tv);
245# else
246 return futimes(req->file, tv);
247# endif
248#elif defined(__MVS__)
249 attrib_t atr;
250 memset(&atr, 0, sizeof(atr));
251 atr.att_mtimechg = 1;
252 atr.att_atimechg = 1;
253 atr.att_mtime = req->mtime;
254 atr.att_atime = req->atime;
255 return __fchattr(req->file, &atr, sizeof(atr));
256#else
257 errno = ENOSYS;
258 return -1;
259#endif
260}
261
262
263static ssize_t uv__fs_mkdtemp(uv_fs_t* req) {
264 return mkdtemp((char*) req->path) ? 0 : -1;
265}
266
267
268static int (*uv__mkostemp)(char*, int);
269
270
271static void uv__mkostemp_initonce(void) {
272 /* z/os doesn't have RTLD_DEFAULT but that's okay
273 * because it doesn't have mkostemp(O_CLOEXEC) either.
274 */
275#ifdef RTLD_DEFAULT
276 uv__mkostemp = (int (*)(char*, int)) dlsym(RTLD_DEFAULT, "mkostemp");
277
278 /* We don't care about errors, but we do want to clean them up.
279 * If there has been no error, then dlerror() will just return
280 * NULL.
281 */
282 dlerror();
283#endif /* RTLD_DEFAULT */
284}
285
286
287static int uv__fs_mkstemp(uv_fs_t* req) {
288 static uv_once_t once = UV_ONCE_INIT;
289 int r;
290#ifdef O_CLOEXEC
291 static int no_cloexec_support;
292#endif
293 static const char pattern[] = "XXXXXX";
294 static const size_t pattern_size = sizeof(pattern) - 1;
295 char* path;
296 size_t path_length;
297
298 path = (char*) req->path;
299 path_length = strlen(path);
300
301 /* EINVAL can be returned for 2 reasons:
302 1. The template's last 6 characters were not XXXXXX
303 2. open() didn't support O_CLOEXEC
304 We want to avoid going to the fallback path in case
305 of 1, so it's manually checked before. */
306 if (path_length < pattern_size ||
307 strcmp(path + path_length - pattern_size, pattern)) {
308 errno = EINVAL;
309 return -1;
310 }
311
312 uv_once(&once, uv__mkostemp_initonce);
313
314#ifdef O_CLOEXEC
315 if (uv__load_relaxed(&no_cloexec_support) == 0 && uv__mkostemp != NULL) {
316 r = uv__mkostemp(path, O_CLOEXEC);
317
318 if (r >= 0)
319 return r;
320
321 /* If mkostemp() returns EINVAL, it means the kernel doesn't
322 support O_CLOEXEC, so we just fallback to mkstemp() below. */
323 if (errno != EINVAL)
324 return r;
325
326 /* We set the static variable so that next calls don't even
327 try to use mkostemp. */
328 uv__store_relaxed(&no_cloexec_support, 1);
329 }
330#endif /* O_CLOEXEC */
331
332 if (req->cb != NULL)
333 uv_rwlock_rdlock(&req->loop->cloexec_lock);
334
335 r = mkstemp(path);
336
337 /* In case of failure `uv__cloexec` will leave error in `errno`,
338 * so it is enough to just set `r` to `-1`.
339 */
340 if (r >= 0 && uv__cloexec(r, 1) != 0) {
341 r = uv__close(r);
342 if (r != 0)
343 abort();
344 r = -1;
345 }
346
347 if (req->cb != NULL)
348 uv_rwlock_rdunlock(&req->loop->cloexec_lock);
349
350 return r;
351}
352
353
354static ssize_t uv__fs_open(uv_fs_t* req) {
355#ifdef O_CLOEXEC
356 return open(req->path, req->flags | O_CLOEXEC, req->mode);
357#else /* O_CLOEXEC */
358 int r;
359
360 if (req->cb != NULL)
361 uv_rwlock_rdlock(&req->loop->cloexec_lock);
362
363 r = open(req->path, req->flags, req->mode);
364
365 /* In case of failure `uv__cloexec` will leave error in `errno`,
366 * so it is enough to just set `r` to `-1`.
367 */
368 if (r >= 0 && uv__cloexec(r, 1) != 0) {
369 r = uv__close(r);
370 if (r != 0)
371 abort();
372 r = -1;
373 }
374
375 if (req->cb != NULL)
376 uv_rwlock_rdunlock(&req->loop->cloexec_lock);
377
378 return r;
379#endif /* O_CLOEXEC */
380}
381
382
383#if !HAVE_PREADV
384static ssize_t uv__fs_preadv(uv_file fd,
385 uv_buf_t* bufs,
386 unsigned int nbufs,
387 off_t off) {
388 uv_buf_t* buf;
389 uv_buf_t* end;
390 ssize_t result;
391 ssize_t rc;
392 size_t pos;
393
394 assert(nbufs > 0);
395
396 result = 0;
397 pos = 0;
398 buf = bufs + 0;
399 end = bufs + nbufs;
400
401 for (;;) {
402 do
403 rc = pread(fd, buf->base + pos, buf->len - pos, off + result);
404 while (rc == -1 && errno == EINTR);
405
406 if (rc == 0)
407 break;
408
409 if (rc == -1 && result == 0)
410 return UV__ERR(errno);
411
412 if (rc == -1)
413 break; /* We read some data so return that, ignore the error. */
414
415 pos += rc;
416 result += rc;
417
418 if (pos < buf->len)
419 continue;
420
421 pos = 0;
422 buf += 1;
423
424 if (buf == end)
425 break;
426 }
427
428 return result;
429}
430#endif
431
432
433static ssize_t uv__fs_read(uv_fs_t* req) {
434#if defined(__linux__)
435 static int no_preadv;
436#endif
437 unsigned int iovmax;
438 ssize_t result;
439
440 iovmax = uv__getiovmax();
441 if (req->nbufs > iovmax)
442 req->nbufs = iovmax;
443
444 if (req->off < 0) {
445 if (req->nbufs == 1)
446 result = read(req->file, req->bufs[0].base, req->bufs[0].len);
447 else
448 result = readv(req->file, (struct iovec*) req->bufs, req->nbufs);
449 } else {
450 if (req->nbufs == 1) {
451 result = pread(req->file, req->bufs[0].base, req->bufs[0].len, req->off);
452 goto done;
453 }
454
455#if HAVE_PREADV
456 result = preadv(req->file, (struct iovec*) req->bufs, req->nbufs, req->off);
457#else
458# if defined(__linux__)
459 if (uv__load_relaxed(&no_preadv)) retry:
460# endif
461 {
462 result = uv__fs_preadv(req->file, req->bufs, req->nbufs, req->off);
463 }
464# if defined(__linux__)
465 else {
466 result = uv__preadv(req->file,
467 (struct iovec*)req->bufs,
468 req->nbufs,
469 req->off);
470 if (result == -1 && errno == ENOSYS) {
471 uv__store_relaxed(&no_preadv, 1);
472 goto retry;
473 }
474 }
475# endif
476#endif
477 }
478
479done:
480 /* Early cleanup of bufs allocation, since we're done with it. */
481 if (req->bufs != req->bufsml)
482 uv__free(req->bufs);
483
484 req->bufs = NULL;
485 req->nbufs = 0;
486
487#ifdef __PASE__
488 /* PASE returns EOPNOTSUPP when reading a directory, convert to EISDIR */
489 if (result == -1 && errno == EOPNOTSUPP) {
490 struct stat buf;
491 ssize_t rc;
492 rc = fstat(req->file, &buf);
493 if (rc == 0 && S_ISDIR(buf.st_mode)) {
494 errno = EISDIR;
495 }
496 }
497#endif
498
499 return result;
500}
501
502
503#if defined(__APPLE__) && !defined(MAC_OS_X_VERSION_10_8)
504#define UV_CONST_DIRENT uv__dirent_t
505#else
506#define UV_CONST_DIRENT const uv__dirent_t
507#endif
508
509
510static int uv__fs_scandir_filter(UV_CONST_DIRENT* dent) {
511 return strcmp(dent->d_name, ".") != 0 && strcmp(dent->d_name, "..") != 0;
512}
513
514
515static int uv__fs_scandir_sort(UV_CONST_DIRENT** a, UV_CONST_DIRENT** b) {
516 return strcmp((*a)->d_name, (*b)->d_name);
517}
518
519
520static ssize_t uv__fs_scandir(uv_fs_t* req) {
521 uv__dirent_t** dents;
522 int n;
523
524 dents = NULL;
525 n = scandir(req->path, &dents, uv__fs_scandir_filter, uv__fs_scandir_sort);
526
527 /* NOTE: We will use nbufs as an index field */
528 req->nbufs = 0;
529
530 if (n == 0) {
531 /* OS X still needs to deallocate some memory.
532 * Memory was allocated using the system allocator, so use free() here.
533 */
534 free(dents);
535 dents = NULL;
536 } else if (n == -1) {
537 return n;
538 }
539
540 req->ptr = dents;
541
542 return n;
543}
544
545static int uv__fs_opendir(uv_fs_t* req) {
546 uv_dir_t* dir;
547
548 dir = uv__malloc(sizeof(*dir));
549 if (dir == NULL)
550 goto error;
551
552 dir->dir = opendir(req->path);
553 if (dir->dir == NULL)
554 goto error;
555
556 req->ptr = dir;
557 return 0;
558
559error:
560 uv__free(dir);
561 req->ptr = NULL;
562 return -1;
563}
564
565static int uv__fs_readdir(uv_fs_t* req) {
566 uv_dir_t* dir;
567 uv_dirent_t* dirent;
568 struct dirent* res;
569 unsigned int dirent_idx;
570 unsigned int i;
571
572 dir = req->ptr;
573 dirent_idx = 0;
574
575 while (dirent_idx < dir->nentries) {
576 /* readdir() returns NULL on end of directory, as well as on error. errno
577 is used to differentiate between the two conditions. */
578 errno = 0;
579 res = readdir(dir->dir);
580
581 if (res == NULL) {
582 if (errno != 0)
583 goto error;
584 break;
585 }
586
587 if (strcmp(res->d_name, ".") == 0 || strcmp(res->d_name, "..") == 0)
588 continue;
589
590 dirent = &dir->dirents[dirent_idx];
591 dirent->name = uv__strdup(res->d_name);
592
593 if (dirent->name == NULL)
594 goto error;
595
596 dirent->type = uv__fs_get_dirent_type(res);
597 ++dirent_idx;
598 }
599
600 return dirent_idx;
601
602error:
603 for (i = 0; i < dirent_idx; ++i) {
604 uv__free((char*) dir->dirents[i].name);
605 dir->dirents[i].name = NULL;
606 }
607
608 return -1;
609}
610
611static int uv__fs_closedir(uv_fs_t* req) {
612 uv_dir_t* dir;
613
614 dir = req->ptr;
615
616 if (dir->dir != NULL) {
617 closedir(dir->dir);
618 dir->dir = NULL;
619 }
620
621 uv__free(req->ptr);
622 req->ptr = NULL;
623 return 0;
624}
625
626static int uv__fs_statfs(uv_fs_t* req) {
627 uv_statfs_t* stat_fs;
628#if defined(__sun) || defined(__MVS__) || defined(__NetBSD__) || defined(__HAIKU__)
629 struct statvfs buf;
630
631 if (0 != statvfs(req->path, &buf))
632#else
633 struct statfs buf;
634
635 if (0 != statfs(req->path, &buf))
636#endif /* defined(__sun) */
637 return -1;
638
639 stat_fs = uv__malloc(sizeof(*stat_fs));
640 if (stat_fs == NULL) {
641 errno = ENOMEM;
642 return -1;
643 }
644
645#if defined(__sun) || defined(__MVS__) || defined(__OpenBSD__) || defined(__NetBSD__) || defined(__HAIKU__)
646 stat_fs->f_type = 0; /* f_type is not supported. */
647#else
648 stat_fs->f_type = buf.f_type;
649#endif
650 stat_fs->f_bsize = buf.f_bsize;
651 stat_fs->f_blocks = buf.f_blocks;
652 stat_fs->f_bfree = buf.f_bfree;
653 stat_fs->f_bavail = buf.f_bavail;
654 stat_fs->f_files = buf.f_files;
655 stat_fs->f_ffree = buf.f_ffree;
656 req->ptr = stat_fs;
657 return 0;
658}
659
660static ssize_t uv__fs_pathmax_size(const char* path) {
661 ssize_t pathmax;
662
663 pathmax = pathconf(path, _PC_PATH_MAX);
664
665 if (pathmax == -1)
666 pathmax = UV__PATH_MAX;
667
668 return pathmax;
669}
670
671static ssize_t uv__fs_readlink(uv_fs_t* req) {
672 ssize_t maxlen;
673 ssize_t len;
674 char* buf;
675
676#if defined(_POSIX_PATH_MAX) || defined(PATH_MAX)
677 maxlen = uv__fs_pathmax_size(req->path);
678#else
679 /* We may not have a real PATH_MAX. Read size of link. */
680 struct stat st;
681 int ret;
682 ret = lstat(req->path, &st);
683 if (ret != 0)
684 return -1;
685 if (!S_ISLNK(st.st_mode)) {
686 errno = EINVAL;
687 return -1;
688 }
689
690 maxlen = st.st_size;
691
692 /* According to readlink(2) lstat can report st_size == 0
693 for some symlinks, such as those in /proc or /sys. */
694 if (maxlen == 0)
695 maxlen = uv__fs_pathmax_size(req->path);
696#endif
697
698 buf = uv__malloc(maxlen);
699
700 if (buf == NULL) {
701 errno = ENOMEM;
702 return -1;
703 }
704
705#if defined(__MVS__)
706 len = os390_readlink(req->path, buf, maxlen);
707#else
708 len = readlink(req->path, buf, maxlen);
709#endif
710
711 if (len == -1) {
712 uv__free(buf);
713 return -1;
714 }
715
716 /* Uncommon case: resize to make room for the trailing nul byte. */
717 if (len == maxlen) {
718 buf = uv__reallocf(buf, len + 1);
719
720 if (buf == NULL)
721 return -1;
722 }
723
724 buf[len] = '\0';
725 req->ptr = buf;
726
727 return 0;
728}
729
730static ssize_t uv__fs_realpath(uv_fs_t* req) {
731 char* buf;
732
733#if defined(_POSIX_VERSION) && _POSIX_VERSION >= 200809L
734 buf = realpath(req->path, NULL);
735 if (buf == NULL)
736 return -1;
737#else
738 ssize_t len;
739
740 len = uv__fs_pathmax_size(req->path);
741 buf = uv__malloc(len + 1);
742
743 if (buf == NULL) {
744 errno = ENOMEM;
745 return -1;
746 }
747
748 if (realpath(req->path, buf) == NULL) {
749 uv__free(buf);
750 return -1;
751 }
752#endif
753
754 req->ptr = buf;
755
756 return 0;
757}
758
759static ssize_t uv__fs_sendfile_emul(uv_fs_t* req) {
760 struct pollfd pfd;
761 int use_pread;
762 off_t offset;
763 ssize_t nsent;
764 ssize_t nread;
765 ssize_t nwritten;
766 size_t buflen;
767 size_t len;
768 ssize_t n;
769 int in_fd;
770 int out_fd;
771 char buf[8192];
772
773 len = req->bufsml[0].len;
774 in_fd = req->flags;
775 out_fd = req->file;
776 offset = req->off;
777 use_pread = 1;
778
779 /* Here are the rules regarding errors:
780 *
781 * 1. Read errors are reported only if nsent==0, otherwise we return nsent.
782 * The user needs to know that some data has already been sent, to stop
783 * them from sending it twice.
784 *
785 * 2. Write errors are always reported. Write errors are bad because they
786 * mean data loss: we've read data but now we can't write it out.
787 *
788 * We try to use pread() and fall back to regular read() if the source fd
789 * doesn't support positional reads, for example when it's a pipe fd.
790 *
791 * If we get EAGAIN when writing to the target fd, we poll() on it until
792 * it becomes writable again.
793 *
794 * FIXME: If we get a write error when use_pread==1, it should be safe to
795 * return the number of sent bytes instead of an error because pread()
796 * is, in theory, idempotent. However, special files in /dev or /proc
797 * may support pread() but not necessarily return the same data on
798 * successive reads.
799 *
800 * FIXME: There is no way now to signal that we managed to send *some* data
801 * before a write error.
802 */
803 for (nsent = 0; (size_t) nsent < len; ) {
804 buflen = len - nsent;
805
806 if (buflen > sizeof(buf))
807 buflen = sizeof(buf);
808
809 do
810 if (use_pread)
811 nread = pread(in_fd, buf, buflen, offset);
812 else
813 nread = read(in_fd, buf, buflen);
814 while (nread == -1 && errno == EINTR);
815
816 if (nread == 0)
817 goto out;
818
819 if (nread == -1) {
820 if (use_pread && nsent == 0 && (errno == EIO || errno == ESPIPE)) {
821 use_pread = 0;
822 continue;
823 }
824
825 if (nsent == 0)
826 nsent = -1;
827
828 goto out;
829 }
830
831 for (nwritten = 0; nwritten < nread; ) {
832 do
833 n = write(out_fd, buf + nwritten, nread - nwritten);
834 while (n == -1 && errno == EINTR);
835
836 if (n != -1) {
837 nwritten += n;
838 continue;
839 }
840
841 if (errno != EAGAIN && errno != EWOULDBLOCK) {
842 nsent = -1;
843 goto out;
844 }
845
846 pfd.fd = out_fd;
847 pfd.events = POLLOUT;
848 pfd.revents = 0;
849
850 do
851 n = poll(&pfd, 1, -1);
852 while (n == -1 && errno == EINTR);
853
854 if (n == -1 || (pfd.revents & ~POLLOUT) != 0) {
855 errno = EIO;
856 nsent = -1;
857 goto out;
858 }
859 }
860
861 offset += nread;
862 nsent += nread;
863 }
864
865out:
866 if (nsent != -1)
867 req->off = offset;
868
869 return nsent;
870}
871
872
873static ssize_t uv__fs_sendfile(uv_fs_t* req) {
874 int in_fd;
875 int out_fd;
876
877 in_fd = req->flags;
878 out_fd = req->file;
879
880#if defined(__linux__) || defined(__sun)
881 {
882 off_t off;
883 ssize_t r;
884
885 off = req->off;
886 r = sendfile(out_fd, in_fd, &off, req->bufsml[0].len);
887
888 /* sendfile() on SunOS returns EINVAL if the target fd is not a socket but
889 * it still writes out data. Fortunately, we can detect it by checking if
890 * the offset has been updated.
891 */
892 if (r != -1 || off > req->off) {
893 r = off - req->off;
894 req->off = off;
895 return r;
896 }
897
898 if (errno == EINVAL ||
899 errno == EIO ||
900 errno == ENOTSOCK ||
901 errno == EXDEV) {
902 errno = 0;
903 return uv__fs_sendfile_emul(req);
904 }
905
906 return -1;
907 }
908#elif defined(__APPLE__) || \
909 defined(__DragonFly__) || \
910 defined(__FreeBSD__) || \
911 defined(__FreeBSD_kernel__)
912 {
913 off_t len;
914 ssize_t r;
915
916 /* sendfile() on FreeBSD and Darwin returns EAGAIN if the target fd is in
917 * non-blocking mode and not all data could be written. If a non-zero
918 * number of bytes have been sent, we don't consider it an error.
919 */
920
921#if defined(__FreeBSD__) || defined(__DragonFly__)
922 len = 0;
923 r = sendfile(in_fd, out_fd, req->off, req->bufsml[0].len, NULL, &len, 0);
924#elif defined(__FreeBSD_kernel__)
925 len = 0;
926 r = bsd_sendfile(in_fd,
927 out_fd,
928 req->off,
929 req->bufsml[0].len,
930 NULL,
931 &len,
932 0);
933#else
934 /* The darwin sendfile takes len as an input for the length to send,
935 * so make sure to initialize it with the caller's value. */
936 len = req->bufsml[0].len;
937 r = sendfile(in_fd, out_fd, req->off, &len, NULL, 0);
938#endif
939
940 /*
941 * The man page for sendfile(2) on DragonFly states that `len` contains
942 * a meaningful value ONLY in case of EAGAIN and EINTR.
943 * Nothing is said about it's value in case of other errors, so better
944 * not depend on the potential wrong assumption that is was not modified
945 * by the syscall.
946 */
947 if (r == 0 || ((errno == EAGAIN || errno == EINTR) && len != 0)) {
948 req->off += len;
949 return (ssize_t) len;
950 }
951
952 if (errno == EINVAL ||
953 errno == EIO ||
954 errno == ENOTSOCK ||
955 errno == EXDEV) {
956 errno = 0;
957 return uv__fs_sendfile_emul(req);
958 }
959
960 return -1;
961 }
962#else
963 /* Squelch compiler warnings. */
964 (void) &in_fd;
965 (void) &out_fd;
966
967 return uv__fs_sendfile_emul(req);
968#endif
969}
970
971
972static ssize_t uv__fs_utime(uv_fs_t* req) {
973#if defined(__linux__) \
974 || defined(_AIX71) \
975 || defined(__sun) \
976 || defined(__HAIKU__)
977 /* utimesat() has nanosecond resolution but we stick to microseconds
978 * for the sake of consistency with other platforms.
979 */
980 struct timespec ts[2];
981 ts[0] = uv__fs_to_timespec(req->atime);
982 ts[1] = uv__fs_to_timespec(req->mtime);
983 return utimensat(AT_FDCWD, req->path, ts, 0);
984#elif defined(__APPLE__) \
985 || defined(__DragonFly__) \
986 || defined(__FreeBSD__) \
987 || defined(__FreeBSD_kernel__) \
988 || defined(__NetBSD__) \
989 || defined(__OpenBSD__)
990 struct timeval tv[2];
991 tv[0] = uv__fs_to_timeval(req->atime);
992 tv[1] = uv__fs_to_timeval(req->mtime);
993 return utimes(req->path, tv);
994#elif defined(_AIX) \
995 && !defined(_AIX71)
996 struct utimbuf buf;
997 buf.actime = req->atime;
998 buf.modtime = req->mtime;
999 return utime(req->path, &buf);
1000#elif defined(__MVS__)
1001 attrib_t atr;
1002 memset(&atr, 0, sizeof(atr));
1003 atr.att_mtimechg = 1;
1004 atr.att_atimechg = 1;
1005 atr.att_mtime = req->mtime;
1006 atr.att_atime = req->atime;
1007 return __lchattr((char*) req->path, &atr, sizeof(atr));
1008#else
1009 errno = ENOSYS;
1010 return -1;
1011#endif
1012}
1013
1014
1015static ssize_t uv__fs_lutime(uv_fs_t* req) {
1016#if defined(__linux__) || \
1017 defined(_AIX71) || \
1018 defined(__sun) || \
1019 defined(__HAIKU__)
1020 struct timespec ts[2];
1021 ts[0] = uv__fs_to_timespec(req->atime);
1022 ts[1] = uv__fs_to_timespec(req->mtime);
1023 return utimensat(AT_FDCWD, req->path, ts, AT_SYMLINK_NOFOLLOW);
1024#elif defined(__APPLE__) || \
1025 defined(__DragonFly__) || \
1026 defined(__FreeBSD__) || \
1027 defined(__FreeBSD_kernel__) || \
1028 defined(__NetBSD__)
1029 struct timeval tv[2];
1030 tv[0] = uv__fs_to_timeval(req->atime);
1031 tv[1] = uv__fs_to_timeval(req->mtime);
1032 return lutimes(req->path, tv);
1033#else
1034 errno = ENOSYS;
1035 return -1;
1036#endif
1037}
1038
1039
1040static ssize_t uv__fs_write(uv_fs_t* req) {
1041#if defined(__linux__)
1042 static int no_pwritev;
1043#endif
1044 ssize_t r;
1045
1046 /* Serialize writes on OS X, concurrent write() and pwrite() calls result in
1047 * data loss. We can't use a per-file descriptor lock, the descriptor may be
1048 * a dup().
1049 */
1050#if defined(__APPLE__)
1051 static pthread_mutex_t lock = PTHREAD_MUTEX_INITIALIZER;
1052
1053 if (pthread_mutex_lock(&lock))
1054 abort();
1055#endif
1056
1057 if (req->off < 0) {
1058 if (req->nbufs == 1)
1059 r = write(req->file, req->bufs[0].base, req->bufs[0].len);
1060 else
1061 r = writev(req->file, (struct iovec*) req->bufs, req->nbufs);
1062 } else {
1063 if (req->nbufs == 1) {
1064 r = pwrite(req->file, req->bufs[0].base, req->bufs[0].len, req->off);
1065 goto done;
1066 }
1067#if HAVE_PREADV
1068 r = pwritev(req->file, (struct iovec*) req->bufs, req->nbufs, req->off);
1069#else
1070# if defined(__linux__)
1071 if (no_pwritev) retry:
1072# endif
1073 {
1074 r = pwrite(req->file, req->bufs[0].base, req->bufs[0].len, req->off);
1075 }
1076# if defined(__linux__)
1077 else {
1078 r = uv__pwritev(req->file,
1079 (struct iovec*) req->bufs,
1080 req->nbufs,
1081 req->off);
1082 if (r == -1 && errno == ENOSYS) {
1083 no_pwritev = 1;
1084 goto retry;
1085 }
1086 }
1087# endif
1088#endif
1089 }
1090
1091done:
1092#if defined(__APPLE__)
1093 if (pthread_mutex_unlock(&lock))
1094 abort();
1095#endif
1096
1097 return r;
1098}
1099
1100static ssize_t uv__fs_copyfile(uv_fs_t* req) {
1101 uv_fs_t fs_req;
1102 uv_file srcfd;
1103 uv_file dstfd;
1104 struct stat src_statsbuf;
1105 struct stat dst_statsbuf;
1106 int dst_flags;
1107 int result;
1108 int err;
1109 off_t bytes_to_send;
1110 off_t in_offset;
1111 off_t bytes_written;
1112 size_t bytes_chunk;
1113
1114 dstfd = -1;
1115 err = 0;
1116
1117 /* Open the source file. */
1118 srcfd = uv_fs_open(NULL, &fs_req, req->path, O_RDONLY, 0, NULL);
1119 uv_fs_req_cleanup(&fs_req);
1120
1121 if (srcfd < 0)
1122 return srcfd;
1123
1124 /* Get the source file's mode. */
1125 if (fstat(srcfd, &src_statsbuf)) {
1126 err = UV__ERR(errno);
1127 goto out;
1128 }
1129
1130 dst_flags = O_WRONLY | O_CREAT | O_TRUNC;
1131
1132 if (req->flags & UV_FS_COPYFILE_EXCL)
1133 dst_flags |= O_EXCL;
1134
1135 /* Open the destination file. */
1136 dstfd = uv_fs_open(NULL,
1137 &fs_req,
1138 req->new_path,
1139 dst_flags,
1140 src_statsbuf.st_mode,
1141 NULL);
1142 uv_fs_req_cleanup(&fs_req);
1143
1144 if (dstfd < 0) {
1145 err = dstfd;
1146 goto out;
1147 }
1148
1149 /* Get the destination file's mode. */
1150 if (fstat(dstfd, &dst_statsbuf)) {
1151 err = UV__ERR(errno);
1152 goto out;
1153 }
1154
1155 /* Check if srcfd and dstfd refer to the same file */
1156 if (src_statsbuf.st_dev == dst_statsbuf.st_dev &&
1157 src_statsbuf.st_ino == dst_statsbuf.st_ino) {
1158 goto out;
1159 }
1160
1161 if (fchmod(dstfd, src_statsbuf.st_mode) == -1) {
1162 err = UV__ERR(errno);
1163#ifdef __linux__
1164 if (err != UV_EPERM)
1165 goto out;
1166
1167 {
1168 struct statfs s;
1169
1170 /* fchmod() on CIFS shares always fails with EPERM unless the share is
1171 * mounted with "noperm". As fchmod() is a meaningless operation on such
1172 * shares anyway, detect that condition and squelch the error.
1173 */
1174 if (fstatfs(dstfd, &s) == -1)
1175 goto out;
1176
1177 if (s.f_type != /* CIFS */ 0xFF534D42u)
1178 goto out;
1179 }
1180
1181 err = 0;
1182#else /* !__linux__ */
1183 goto out;
1184#endif /* !__linux__ */
1185 }
1186
1187#ifdef FICLONE
1188 if (req->flags & UV_FS_COPYFILE_FICLONE ||
1189 req->flags & UV_FS_COPYFILE_FICLONE_FORCE) {
1190 if (ioctl(dstfd, FICLONE, srcfd) == 0) {
1191 /* ioctl() with FICLONE succeeded. */
1192 goto out;
1193 }
1194 /* If an error occurred and force was set, return the error to the caller;
1195 * fall back to sendfile() when force was not set. */
1196 if (req->flags & UV_FS_COPYFILE_FICLONE_FORCE) {
1197 err = UV__ERR(errno);
1198 goto out;
1199 }
1200 }
1201#else
1202 if (req->flags & UV_FS_COPYFILE_FICLONE_FORCE) {
1203 err = UV_ENOSYS;
1204 goto out;
1205 }
1206#endif
1207
1208 bytes_to_send = src_statsbuf.st_size;
1209 in_offset = 0;
1210 while (bytes_to_send != 0) {
1211 bytes_chunk = SSIZE_MAX;
1212 if (bytes_to_send < (off_t) bytes_chunk)
1213 bytes_chunk = bytes_to_send;
1214 uv_fs_sendfile(NULL, &fs_req, dstfd, srcfd, in_offset, bytes_chunk, NULL);
1215 bytes_written = fs_req.result;
1216 uv_fs_req_cleanup(&fs_req);
1217
1218 if (bytes_written < 0) {
1219 err = bytes_written;
1220 break;
1221 }
1222
1223 bytes_to_send -= bytes_written;
1224 in_offset += bytes_written;
1225 }
1226
1227out:
1228 if (err < 0)
1229 result = err;
1230 else
1231 result = 0;
1232
1233 /* Close the source file. */
1234 err = uv__close_nocheckstdio(srcfd);
1235
1236 /* Don't overwrite any existing errors. */
1237 if (err != 0 && result == 0)
1238 result = err;
1239
1240 /* Close the destination file if it is open. */
1241 if (dstfd >= 0) {
1242 err = uv__close_nocheckstdio(dstfd);
1243
1244 /* Don't overwrite any existing errors. */
1245 if (err != 0 && result == 0)
1246 result = err;
1247
1248 /* Remove the destination file if something went wrong. */
1249 if (result != 0) {
1250 uv_fs_unlink(NULL, &fs_req, req->new_path, NULL);
1251 /* Ignore the unlink return value, as an error already happened. */
1252 uv_fs_req_cleanup(&fs_req);
1253 }
1254 }
1255
1256 if (result == 0)
1257 return 0;
1258
1259 errno = UV__ERR(result);
1260 return -1;
1261}
1262
1263static void uv__to_stat(struct stat* src, uv_stat_t* dst) {
1264 dst->st_dev = src->st_dev;
1265 dst->st_mode = src->st_mode;
1266 dst->st_nlink = src->st_nlink;
1267 dst->st_uid = src->st_uid;
1268 dst->st_gid = src->st_gid;
1269 dst->st_rdev = src->st_rdev;
1270 dst->st_ino = src->st_ino;
1271 dst->st_size = src->st_size;
1272 dst->st_blksize = src->st_blksize;
1273 dst->st_blocks = src->st_blocks;
1274
1275#if defined(__APPLE__)
1276 dst->st_atim.tv_sec = src->st_atimespec.tv_sec;
1277 dst->st_atim.tv_nsec = src->st_atimespec.tv_nsec;
1278 dst->st_mtim.tv_sec = src->st_mtimespec.tv_sec;
1279 dst->st_mtim.tv_nsec = src->st_mtimespec.tv_nsec;
1280 dst->st_ctim.tv_sec = src->st_ctimespec.tv_sec;
1281 dst->st_ctim.tv_nsec = src->st_ctimespec.tv_nsec;
1282 dst->st_birthtim.tv_sec = src->st_birthtimespec.tv_sec;
1283 dst->st_birthtim.tv_nsec = src->st_birthtimespec.tv_nsec;
1284 dst->st_flags = src->st_flags;
1285 dst->st_gen = src->st_gen;
1286#elif defined(__ANDROID__)
1287 dst->st_atim.tv_sec = src->st_atime;
1288 dst->st_atim.tv_nsec = src->st_atimensec;
1289 dst->st_mtim.tv_sec = src->st_mtime;
1290 dst->st_mtim.tv_nsec = src->st_mtimensec;
1291 dst->st_ctim.tv_sec = src->st_ctime;
1292 dst->st_ctim.tv_nsec = src->st_ctimensec;
1293 dst->st_birthtim.tv_sec = src->st_ctime;
1294 dst->st_birthtim.tv_nsec = src->st_ctimensec;
1295 dst->st_flags = 0;
1296 dst->st_gen = 0;
1297#elif !defined(_AIX) && ( \
1298 defined(__DragonFly__) || \
1299 defined(__FreeBSD__) || \
1300 defined(__OpenBSD__) || \
1301 defined(__NetBSD__) || \
1302 defined(_GNU_SOURCE) || \
1303 defined(_BSD_SOURCE) || \
1304 defined(_SVID_SOURCE) || \
1305 defined(_XOPEN_SOURCE) || \
1306 defined(_DEFAULT_SOURCE))
1307 dst->st_atim.tv_sec = src->st_atim.tv_sec;
1308 dst->st_atim.tv_nsec = src->st_atim.tv_nsec;
1309 dst->st_mtim.tv_sec = src->st_mtim.tv_sec;
1310 dst->st_mtim.tv_nsec = src->st_mtim.tv_nsec;
1311 dst->st_ctim.tv_sec = src->st_ctim.tv_sec;
1312 dst->st_ctim.tv_nsec = src->st_ctim.tv_nsec;
1313# if defined(__FreeBSD__) || \
1314 defined(__NetBSD__)
1315 dst->st_birthtim.tv_sec = src->st_birthtim.tv_sec;
1316 dst->st_birthtim.tv_nsec = src->st_birthtim.tv_nsec;
1317 dst->st_flags = src->st_flags;
1318 dst->st_gen = src->st_gen;
1319# else
1320 dst->st_birthtim.tv_sec = src->st_ctim.tv_sec;
1321 dst->st_birthtim.tv_nsec = src->st_ctim.tv_nsec;
1322 dst->st_flags = 0;
1323 dst->st_gen = 0;
1324# endif
1325#else
1326 dst->st_atim.tv_sec = src->st_atime;
1327 dst->st_atim.tv_nsec = 0;
1328 dst->st_mtim.tv_sec = src->st_mtime;
1329 dst->st_mtim.tv_nsec = 0;
1330 dst->st_ctim.tv_sec = src->st_ctime;
1331 dst->st_ctim.tv_nsec = 0;
1332 dst->st_birthtim.tv_sec = src->st_ctime;
1333 dst->st_birthtim.tv_nsec = 0;
1334 dst->st_flags = 0;
1335 dst->st_gen = 0;
1336#endif
1337}
1338
1339
1340static int uv__fs_statx(int fd,
1341 const char* path,
1342 int is_fstat,
1343 int is_lstat,
1344 uv_stat_t* buf) {
1345 STATIC_ASSERT(UV_ENOSYS != -1);
1346#ifdef __linux__
1347 static int no_statx;
1348 struct uv__statx statxbuf;
1349 int dirfd;
1350 int flags;
1351 int mode;
1352 int rc;
1353
1354 if (uv__load_relaxed(&no_statx))
1355 return UV_ENOSYS;
1356
1357 dirfd = AT_FDCWD;
1358 flags = 0; /* AT_STATX_SYNC_AS_STAT */
1359 mode = 0xFFF; /* STATX_BASIC_STATS + STATX_BTIME */
1360
1361 if (is_fstat) {
1362 dirfd = fd;
1363 flags |= 0x1000; /* AT_EMPTY_PATH */
1364 }
1365
1366 if (is_lstat)
1367 flags |= AT_SYMLINK_NOFOLLOW;
1368
1369 rc = uv__statx(dirfd, path, flags, mode, &statxbuf);
1370
1371 switch (rc) {
1372 case 0:
1373 break;
1374 case -1:
1375 /* EPERM happens when a seccomp filter rejects the system call.
1376 * Has been observed with libseccomp < 2.3.3 and docker < 18.04.
1377 */
1378 if (errno != EINVAL && errno != EPERM && errno != ENOSYS)
1379 return -1;
1380 /* Fall through. */
1381 default:
1382 /* Normally on success, zero is returned and On error, -1 is returned.
1383 * Observed on S390 RHEL running in a docker container with statx not
1384 * implemented, rc might return 1 with 0 set as the error code in which
1385 * case we return ENOSYS.
1386 */
1387 uv__store_relaxed(&no_statx, 1);
1388 return UV_ENOSYS;
1389 }
1390
1391 buf->st_dev = 256 * statxbuf.stx_dev_major + statxbuf.stx_dev_minor;
1392 buf->st_mode = statxbuf.stx_mode;
1393 buf->st_nlink = statxbuf.stx_nlink;
1394 buf->st_uid = statxbuf.stx_uid;
1395 buf->st_gid = statxbuf.stx_gid;
1396 buf->st_rdev = statxbuf.stx_rdev_major;
1397 buf->st_ino = statxbuf.stx_ino;
1398 buf->st_size = statxbuf.stx_size;
1399 buf->st_blksize = statxbuf.stx_blksize;
1400 buf->st_blocks = statxbuf.stx_blocks;
1401 buf->st_atim.tv_sec = statxbuf.stx_atime.tv_sec;
1402 buf->st_atim.tv_nsec = statxbuf.stx_atime.tv_nsec;
1403 buf->st_mtim.tv_sec = statxbuf.stx_mtime.tv_sec;
1404 buf->st_mtim.tv_nsec = statxbuf.stx_mtime.tv_nsec;
1405 buf->st_ctim.tv_sec = statxbuf.stx_ctime.tv_sec;
1406 buf->st_ctim.tv_nsec = statxbuf.stx_ctime.tv_nsec;
1407 buf->st_birthtim.tv_sec = statxbuf.stx_btime.tv_sec;
1408 buf->st_birthtim.tv_nsec = statxbuf.stx_btime.tv_nsec;
1409 buf->st_flags = 0;
1410 buf->st_gen = 0;
1411
1412 return 0;
1413#else
1414 return UV_ENOSYS;
1415#endif /* __linux__ */
1416}
1417
1418
1419static int uv__fs_stat(const char *path, uv_stat_t *buf) {
1420 struct stat pbuf;
1421 int ret;
1422
1423 ret = uv__fs_statx(-1, path, /* is_fstat */ 0, /* is_lstat */ 0, buf);
1424 if (ret != UV_ENOSYS)
1425 return ret;
1426
1427 ret = stat(path, &pbuf);
1428 if (ret == 0)
1429 uv__to_stat(&pbuf, buf);
1430
1431 return ret;
1432}
1433
1434
1435static int uv__fs_lstat(const char *path, uv_stat_t *buf) {
1436 struct stat pbuf;
1437 int ret;
1438
1439 ret = uv__fs_statx(-1, path, /* is_fstat */ 0, /* is_lstat */ 1, buf);
1440 if (ret != UV_ENOSYS)
1441 return ret;
1442
1443 ret = lstat(path, &pbuf);
1444 if (ret == 0)
1445 uv__to_stat(&pbuf, buf);
1446
1447 return ret;
1448}
1449
1450
1451static int uv__fs_fstat(int fd, uv_stat_t *buf) {
1452 struct stat pbuf;
1453 int ret;
1454
1455 ret = uv__fs_statx(fd, "", /* is_fstat */ 1, /* is_lstat */ 0, buf);
1456 if (ret != UV_ENOSYS)
1457 return ret;
1458
1459 ret = fstat(fd, &pbuf);
1460 if (ret == 0)
1461 uv__to_stat(&pbuf, buf);
1462
1463 return ret;
1464}
1465
1466static size_t uv__fs_buf_offset(uv_buf_t* bufs, size_t size) {
1467 size_t offset;
1468 /* Figure out which bufs are done */
1469 for (offset = 0; size > 0 && bufs[offset].len <= size; ++offset)
1470 size -= bufs[offset].len;
1471
1472 /* Fix a partial read/write */
1473 if (size > 0) {
1474 bufs[offset].base += size;
1475 bufs[offset].len -= size;
1476 }
1477 return offset;
1478}
1479
1480static ssize_t uv__fs_write_all(uv_fs_t* req) {
1481 unsigned int iovmax;
1482 unsigned int nbufs;
1483 uv_buf_t* bufs;
1484 ssize_t total;
1485 ssize_t result;
1486
1487 iovmax = uv__getiovmax();
1488 nbufs = req->nbufs;
1489 bufs = req->bufs;
1490 total = 0;
1491
1492 while (nbufs > 0) {
1493 req->nbufs = nbufs;
1494 if (req->nbufs > iovmax)
1495 req->nbufs = iovmax;
1496
1497 do
1498 result = uv__fs_write(req);
1499 while (result < 0 && errno == EINTR);
1500
1501 if (result <= 0) {
1502 if (total == 0)
1503 total = result;
1504 break;
1505 }
1506
1507 if (req->off >= 0)
1508 req->off += result;
1509
1510 req->nbufs = uv__fs_buf_offset(req->bufs, result);
1511 req->bufs += req->nbufs;
1512 nbufs -= req->nbufs;
1513 total += result;
1514 }
1515
1516 if (bufs != req->bufsml)
1517 uv__free(bufs);
1518
1519 req->bufs = NULL;
1520 req->nbufs = 0;
1521
1522 return total;
1523}
1524
1525
1526static void uv__fs_work(struct uv__work* w) {
1527 int retry_on_eintr;
1528 uv_fs_t* req;
1529 ssize_t r;
1530
1531 req = container_of(w, uv_fs_t, work_req);
1532 retry_on_eintr = !(req->fs_type == UV_FS_CLOSE ||
1533 req->fs_type == UV_FS_READ);
1534
1535 do {
1536 errno = 0;
1537
1538#define X(type, action) \
1539 case UV_FS_ ## type: \
1540 r = action; \
1541 break;
1542
1543 switch (req->fs_type) {
1544 X(ACCESS, access(req->path, req->flags));
1545 X(CHMOD, chmod(req->path, req->mode));
1546 X(CHOWN, chown(req->path, req->uid, req->gid));
1547 X(CLOSE, uv__fs_close(req->file));
1548 X(COPYFILE, uv__fs_copyfile(req));
1549 X(FCHMOD, fchmod(req->file, req->mode));
1550 X(FCHOWN, fchown(req->file, req->uid, req->gid));
1551 X(LCHOWN, lchown(req->path, req->uid, req->gid));
1552 X(FDATASYNC, uv__fs_fdatasync(req));
1553 X(FSTAT, uv__fs_fstat(req->file, &req->statbuf));
1554 X(FSYNC, uv__fs_fsync(req));
1555 X(FTRUNCATE, ftruncate(req->file, req->off));
1556 X(FUTIME, uv__fs_futime(req));
1557 X(LUTIME, uv__fs_lutime(req));
1558 X(LSTAT, uv__fs_lstat(req->path, &req->statbuf));
1559 X(LINK, link(req->path, req->new_path));
1560 X(MKDIR, mkdir(req->path, req->mode));
1561 X(MKDTEMP, uv__fs_mkdtemp(req));
1562 X(MKSTEMP, uv__fs_mkstemp(req));
1563 X(OPEN, uv__fs_open(req));
1564 X(READ, uv__fs_read(req));
1565 X(SCANDIR, uv__fs_scandir(req));
1566 X(OPENDIR, uv__fs_opendir(req));
1567 X(READDIR, uv__fs_readdir(req));
1568 X(CLOSEDIR, uv__fs_closedir(req));
1569 X(READLINK, uv__fs_readlink(req));
1570 X(REALPATH, uv__fs_realpath(req));
1571 X(RENAME, rename(req->path, req->new_path));
1572 X(RMDIR, rmdir(req->path));
1573 X(SENDFILE, uv__fs_sendfile(req));
1574 X(STAT, uv__fs_stat(req->path, &req->statbuf));
1575 X(STATFS, uv__fs_statfs(req));
1576 X(SYMLINK, symlink(req->path, req->new_path));
1577 X(UNLINK, unlink(req->path));
1578 X(UTIME, uv__fs_utime(req));
1579 X(WRITE, uv__fs_write_all(req));
1580 default: abort();
1581 }
1582#undef X
1583 } while (r == -1 && errno == EINTR && retry_on_eintr);
1584
1585 if (r == -1)
1586 req->result = UV__ERR(errno);
1587 else
1588 req->result = r;
1589
1590 if (r == 0 && (req->fs_type == UV_FS_STAT ||
1591 req->fs_type == UV_FS_FSTAT ||
1592 req->fs_type == UV_FS_LSTAT)) {
1593 req->ptr = &req->statbuf;
1594 }
1595}
1596
1597
1598static void uv__fs_done(struct uv__work* w, int status) {
1599 uv_fs_t* req;
1600
1601 req = container_of(w, uv_fs_t, work_req);
1602 uv__req_unregister(req->loop, req);
1603
1604 if (status == UV_ECANCELED) {
1605 assert(req->result == 0);
1606 req->result = UV_ECANCELED;
1607 }
1608
1609 req->cb(req);
1610}

1825
1826int uv_fs_read(uv_loop_t* loop, uv_fs_t* req,
1827 uv_file file,
1828 const uv_buf_t bufs[],
1829 unsigned int nbufs,
1830 int64_t off,
1831 uv_fs_cb cb) {
1832 INIT(READ);
1833
1834 if (bufs == NULL || nbufs == 0)
1835 return UV_EINVAL;
1836
1837 req->file = file;
1838
1839 req->nbufs = nbufs;
1840 req->bufs = req->bufsml;
1841 if (nbufs > ARRAY_SIZE(req->bufsml))
1842 req->bufs = uv__malloc(nbufs * sizeof(*bufs));
1843
1844 if (req->bufs == NULL)
1845 return UV_ENOMEM;
1846
1847 memcpy(req->bufs, bufs, nbufs * sizeof(*bufs));
1848
1849 req->off = off;
1850 POST;
1851}

1994
1995int uv_fs_write(uv_loop_t* loop,
1996 uv_fs_t* req,
1997 uv_file file,
1998 const uv_buf_t bufs[],
1999 unsigned int nbufs,
2000 int64_t off,
2001 uv_fs_cb cb) {
2002 INIT(WRITE);
2003
2004 if (bufs == NULL || nbufs == 0)
2005 return UV_EINVAL;
2006
2007 req->file = file;
2008
2009 req->nbufs = nbufs;
2010 req->bufs = req->bufsml;
2011 if (nbufs > ARRAY_SIZE(req->bufsml))
2012 req->bufs = uv__malloc(nbufs * sizeof(*bufs));
2013
2014 if (req->bufs == NULL)
2015 return UV_ENOMEM;
2016
2017 memcpy(req->bufs, bufs, nbufs * sizeof(*bufs));
2018
2019 req->off = off;
2020 POST;
2021}
2022
2023
2024void uv_fs_req_cleanup(uv_fs_t* req) {
2025 if (req == NULL)
2026 return;
2027
2028 /* Only necessary for asychronous requests, i.e., requests with a callback.
2029 * Synchronous ones don't copy their arguments and have req->path and
2030 * req->new_path pointing to user-owned memory. UV_FS_MKDTEMP and
2031 * UV_FS_MKSTEMP are the exception to the rule, they always allocate memory.
2032 */
2033 if (req->path != NULL &&
2034 (req->cb != NULL ||
2035 req->fs_type == UV_FS_MKDTEMP || req->fs_type == UV_FS_MKSTEMP))
2036 uv__free((void*) req->path); /* Memory is shared with req->new_path. */
2037
2038 req->path = NULL;
2039 req->new_path = NULL;
2040
2041 if (req->fs_type == UV_FS_READDIR && req->ptr != NULL)
2042 uv__fs_readdir_cleanup(req);
2043
2044 if (req->fs_type == UV_FS_SCANDIR && req->ptr != NULL)
2045 uv__fs_scandir_cleanup(req);
2046
2047 if (req->bufs != req->bufsml)
2048 uv__free(req->bufs);
2049 req->bufs = NULL;
2050
2051 if (req->fs_type != UV_FS_OPENDIR && req->ptr != &req->statbuf)
2052 uv__free(req->ptr);
2053 req->ptr = NULL;
2054}
2055
2056
2057int uv_fs_copyfile(uv_loop_t* loop,
2058 uv_fs_t* req,
2059 const char* path,
2060 const char* new_path,
2061 int flags,
2062 uv_fs_cb cb) {
2063 INIT(COPYFILE);
2064
2065 if (flags & ~(UV_FS_COPYFILE_EXCL |
2066 UV_FS_COPYFILE_FICLONE |
2067 UV_FS_COPYFILE_FICLONE_FORCE)) {
2068 return UV_EINVAL;
2069 }
2070
2071 PATH2;
2072 req->flags = flags;
2073 POST;
2074}

2078 uv_fs_t* req,
2079 const char* path,
2080 uv_fs_cb cb) {
2081 INIT(STATFS);
2082 PATH;
2083 POST;
2084}

2086int uv_fs_get_system_error(const uv_fs_t* req) {
2087 return -req->result;
2088}
